December 21, 1955
Richard L, Spears
2nd Lt. USAF
Chief, Radio-TV Branch
Air leather Service
MATS
U.S. Air Force
Washington, D. C.
Dear Sir:
I am in receipt of several pieces of correspondence between you and
NAEB people concerning a possible series on the weather. I discussed
this with Dr. Skornia and members of the network sub-committee on program
planning on December 3 in Chicago.
We have no doubt of the value and general interest of the topic, but
the group had some reservations about certain units in the 13 week outline
you gave us. Specifically, the committee was apprehensive of (l) picking
up classroom lectures, (2) certain titles heavily oriented toward military
use and possibly not of general interest. Of the latter, it seemed that
Programs 1, 7, 11, and 12 might be of less interest to civilian listeners.
All of us, of course, fully realize that you can likely defend these
matters quite adequately, and that you would be willing to submit a
sample program. I strongly suggest that you do this, sending such tap©
to me or to Dr. Harry Skornia at NAEB headquarters. 1 will see that it
gets to the sub-committees on planning and on acceptance without delay.
Many thanks for submitting the idea to us; it certainly has genuine
merit and I hope the series can be broadcast on the network.
Sincerely,
Kenneth D, bright
Director of Broadcasting
Chairman, Sub-Committee on
Network Radio Program Planning
